Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.check

Class Check

java.lang.Object
nl.naturalis.common.check.Check
public final class Check extends Object
Facilitates precondition and postcondition checking. See the package description for a detailed explanation.
Author:
Ayco Holleman

    • that

      public static <U> ObjectCheck<U,IllegalArgumentException> that(U arg)
      Static factory method. Returns a new Check instance suitable for testing the provided argument.
      Type Parameters:
      U - The type of the argument
      Parameters:
      arg - The argument
      Returns:
      A Check object suitable for testing the provided argument

      argName - The name of the argument
      Returns:
      A new Check object

    • notNull

      public static <U> ObjectCheck<U,IllegalArgumentException> notNull(U arg) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Static factory method. Returns a new Check instance suitable for testing the provided argument. The argument will have already passed the notNull test.
      Type Parameters:
      U - The type of the argument
      Parameters:
      arg - The argument
      Returns:
      A new Check object
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • notNull

    • on

      public static <X extends Exception> IntCheck<X> on(Function<String,X> excFactory, int arg)
      Static factory method. Returns a new Check instance suitable for testing integers.
      Type Parameters:
      X - The type of Exception thrown if the argument fails to pass a test
      Parameters:
      excFactory - A Function that will produce the exception if a test fails. The Function will be passed a String (the error message) and must return the Exception to be thrown
      arg - The argument
      Returns:
      A Check object suitable for testing int arguments

    • on

      public static <U, X extends Exception> ObjectCheck<U,X> on(Function<String,X> excFactory, U arg)
      Static factory method. Returns a new Check instance suitable for testing the provided argument.
      Type Parameters:
      U - The type of the argument
      X - The type of Exception thrown if the argument fails to pass a test
      Parameters:
      excFactory - A Function that will produce the exception if a test fails. The Function will be passed a String (the error message) and must return the Exception to be thrown
      arg - The argument
      Returns:
      A Check object suitable for testing the provided argument

    • on

      Static factory method. Returns a new Check instance suitable for testing integers.
      Type Parameters:
      X - The type of Exception thrown if the argument fails to pass a test
      Parameters:
      excFactory - A Function that will produce the exception if a test fails. The Function will be passed a String (the error message) and must return the Exception to be thrown
      arg - The argument
      argName - The name of the argument

      public static <U, X extends Exception> ObjectCheck<U,X> on(Function<String,X> excFactory, U arg, String argName)

      Type Parameters:
      U - The type of the argument
      X - The type of Exception thrown if the argument fails to pass a test
      Parameters:

      arg - The argument
      argName - The name of the argument
      Returns:
      A new Check object

    • offsetLength

      public static void offsetLength(byte[] array, int offset, int length)
      Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the provided array is null. Throws an IndexOutOfBoundsException if:
      • offset or length is less than zero
      • offset + length is greater than the array's length
      Parameters:
      array - the array
      offset - the offset within the array
      length - the length of the segment
      See Also:
      • offsetLength(int, int, int)

    • offsetLength

      public static void offsetLength(int size, int offset, int length)
      Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the provided array is null. Throws an IndexOutOfBoundsException if:
      • size or offset or length is less than zero
      • offset + length is greater than size
      Parameters:
      size - the length of the array or array-like object from which to extract the segment
      offset - the offset of the segment
      length - the length of the segment

    • fromTo

      public static int fromTo(List<?> list, int fromIndex, int toIndex)
      Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the provided list is null. Throws an IndexOutOfBoundsException if:
      • fromIndex or toIndex is less than zero
      • toIndex is less than fromIndex
      • the list's size is less than toIndex
      Parameters:
      list - the list
      fromIndex - the start index of the sublist
      toIndex - the end index of the sublist
      Returns:
      the size of the sublist
      See Also:
      • fromTo(int, int, int)
      • List.subList(int, int)

    • fromTo

      public static <T> int fromTo(T[] array, int fromIndex, int toIndex)
      Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the provided array is null. Throws an IndexOutOfBoundsException if:
      • fromIndex or toIndex is less than zero
      • toIndex is less than fromIndex
      • the array's length is less than toIndex
      Parameters:
      array - the array
      fromIndex - the start index of the array segment
      toIndex - the end index of the array segment
      Returns:
      the length of the array segment
      See Also:
      • fromTo(int, int, int)
      • Arrays.copyOfRange(Object[], int, int)

    • fromTo

      public static int fromTo(String string, int fromIndex, int toIndex)
      Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the provided string is null. Throws an IndexOutOfBoundsException if:
      • fromIndex or toIndex is less than zero
      • toIndex is less than fromIndex
      • the string's length is less than toIndex
      Parameters:
      string - The string
      fromIndex - the start index of the substring
      toIndex - the end index of the substring
      Returns:
      the length of the substring
      See Also:
      • fromTo(int, int, int)
      • String.substring(int, int)

    • fromTo

      public static int fromTo(int size, int fromIndex, int toIndex)
      Throws an IndexOutOfBoundsException if:
      • size or fromIndex or toIndex is less than zero
      • toIndex is less than fromIndex
      • size is less than toIndex
      Parameters:
      size - the size (or length) of the array, string, list, etc.
      fromIndex - the start index of the segment
      toIndex - the end index of the segment
      Returns:
      the length of the segment

    • fail

      public static <U> U fail(String msg, Object... msgArgs)
      Throws an IllegalArgumentException with the specified message and message arguments. The method is still declared to return a value of type <U> so it can be used as the expression for a return statement.
      Type Parameters:
      U - The type of the object that would have been returned if it had passed the checks
      Parameters:
      msg - The message
      msgArgs - The message argument
      Returns:
      Nothing, but allows fail to be used as the expression in a return statement

    • fail

      public static <U, X extends Throwable> U fail(Function<String,X> excFactory) throws X
      Throws the exception created by the specified exception factory.
      Type Parameters:
      U - The type of the object that would have been returned if it had passed the checks
      X - The type of the exception
      Parameters:
      excFactory - The exception supplier
      Returns:
      Nothing, but allows fail to be used as the expression in a return statement
      Throws:
      X - The exception that is thrown

    • fail

      public static <U, X extends Throwable> U fail(Function<String,X> excFactory, String msg, Object... msgArgs) throws X
      Throws an exception created by the specified exception factory with the specified message and message arguments.
      Type Parameters:
      U - The type of the object that would have been returned if it had passed the checks
      X - The type of the exception
      Parameters:
      msg - The message
      msgArgs - The message argument
      Returns:
      Nothing, but allows fail to be used as the expression in a return statement
      Throws:
      X - The exception that is thrown
